title: Around the Districts : Annacurra , Aughrim , Avoca , Coolgreany and Rathdrum
body_text:
Around the Districts: Annacurra, Aughrim, Avoca, Coolgreany and Rathdrum
ANNACURRA
Clothing Collection
Annacurra National School are holding a clothing collection on Wednesday 12th June.
We can take: Clean dry wearable men’s, women’s and children’s clothes, shoes, boots (in pairs), Curtains, bed linen, towels. We cannot take: Duvets, Pillows, books, toys or toiletries in this collection.
If you are clearing out your wardrobes in preparation for the summer, please keep us in mind. Clothes can be left into the school anytime between now and the morning of 12th June. All money raised is used for the children.
Summer Concert
There will be a Summer Concert on Saturday June 15th in Ballinatone Church at 8pm. Featuring the Avondale Voices Choir, Dynamics Chamber Choir, three Soloists and three Poetry Readers.
Tickets are €20 (including a glass of wine) and there will be refreshments after the Concert in the Old School Hall. Everyone welcome
Patron Dates
Knockananna: 16th June 2.30pm. Kilamoat: 23rd June at 2.30pm. Preban: 19th July at 7.30pm. Annacurra: 21st July at 7.30pm.
Parish Field day
The Annacurra Parish Field Day takes place on 30th June.
AUGHRIM
Summer Concert
There will be a Summer Concert on Saturday June 15th in Ballinatone Church at 8pm. Featuring the Avondale Voices Choir, Dynamics Chamber Choir, three Soloists and three Poetry Readers.
Tickets are €20 (including a glass of wine) and there will be refreshments after the Concert in the Old School Hall. Everyone welcome
Lotto
The numbers drawn in Aughrim Sports Club lotto on Monday June 3rd were 2, 14, 18 and 28 The jackpot was not won. There was no match three winners. The jackpot for Monday June 10th is €9,350.
GAA News
Congratulations to our Junior A adult footballers who achieved promotion to Division 2 of the football league with a good win over Tinahely in their final match of the league on a score line of Aughrim 2-12 Tinahely 1-9. This is a great achievement for this group of young players and augurs well for the championship. Well done to all and especially the management team of Kevin Morris, Tommy Forsyth and Padraig Connell.
The sympathy of the club is extended to the Murphy family on the sad passing of May RIP.
Town & Country Market
There are a lot of marketeers with fantastic products and produce offerings from barista coffee, fresh biscuits, home baked cakes, artisan breads, frittatas and sausage rolls, plus freshly made garlic pesto, handmade clothing for babies, flower arrangements to beautify homes and workplaces.
We have wooden products and hand painted signs, bird boxes and natural healing products plus hand crafted cushions and hand-crafted jewellery and cards. Artisan bread and home bakes plus a beautiful setting to enjoy with the whole family and even to bring along the dog for a walk. The playground is a fantastic place for the little ones while the New to you Thrift shop offers bargains of all kinds for the whole family. The fishing facility is open and stocked so if fishing is your passion this is the place to be. Bowling green is looking stunning, and the games have started, chat to any member for more information.
Please see @aughrimtownandcountry on Facebook for weekly updates or contact Dave on 083 034 9577 if you want to become a Marketeer or need any information regarding the market. We look forward to seeing you all on Saturday between 10am and 2pm. And if you are not sure where to find us, put Y14WK38 into your google maps and it will bring you right to our front door.
Notes Deadline
Items to be included in the Aughrim notes should be emailed to aughrimnotes@gmail.com before 8 pm on Sundays. Do not send attachments.
AVOCA
Credit Union - mobile unit
Arklow Mobile Credit Union will be in Avoca Church car park every Friday morning from 10am to 12 noon.
Summer Concert in Ballinatone Church
There will be a Summer Concert on Saturday 15th June in Ballinatone Church at 8pm. Featuring the Avondale Voices Choir, Dynamics Chamber Choir, three Soloists and three Poetry Readers.
Tickets are €20 (including a glass of wine) and there will be refreshments after the Concert in the Old School Hall. Everyone welcome.
Conary Community Hall
An Emergency meeting will be held on Monday 17th June at 8.30pm in Conary Community Hall to discuss the future of the hall. Could as many people as possible attend this meeting please.
Avoca notes
Notes should be emailed to avocacourthouse@gmail.com by 4 p.m. on Sunday.
COOLGREANY
Nicky Boland elected Councillor
Congratulations to Nicky Boland, Long Lane who was elected as a County Councillor for our area of North Wexford at the election count last Sunday at the count centre in Wexford. This is the first time that Coolgreany will have its own Councillor.
Nicky is very grateful to everyone in his local area and further afield for the excellent support that was given to him while canvassing, which was much appreciated. This was a great family achievement in its own way. Very well done Nicky and hope you have a great 5 years as a Councillor for the area .
Sympathy
The local community extend their deepest sympathy to the Hackett and McDonald families, Knockgreany on the sad passing of a wife and mother Catherine Hackett. Catherine’s funeral Mass took place last Monday in St David’s Church Johnstown, with burial afterwards in Ballyfad Cemetery
State exams
The best of luck and good wishes to all of the students who have started their Leaving Certificate and Junior Certificate exams in the past week and finish in the middle of the June.
Business Awards
Congratulations to Gardiner Grain on their achievement in winning the overall business of the year award, and also the Family business of the year in Wexford last week. Well done to all involved.
Community Alert
Over the recent past a certain amount of vandalism has occurred in our local area, and we are appealing to everyone to report anything unusual they may see happening, to the Gardai at Gorey on 053-9430690.
Speed Monitor
It is good to see the local speed monitor on the Ballyfad up and running again, as it had been out of order previously. Hopefully the readings will help to control the speed in the area.
Tidy Towns
The Tidy Towns are getting the village all spruced up getting ready for judging in the competition. We need volunteers on the Knockgreany/Ballyfad roadside. The Co Council have been supplying gloves, pickers & bags to help clean our roadside clean up. Gloves and bags are available from Maureen or Marie.
Local notes
Please forward all notes for the local papers to Dan by 6 p.m. on Sunday evening. Email danken9@gmail.com or phone 087 4605166.
RATHDRUM
Avondale GAA
Lotto - Results for Tuesday 4th June. No jackpot winner. Numbers drawn 2,9,23,25. Two match 3 winners: Diarmuid Phelan c/o Online; Ola Steele c/o Online. Thanks for all your continued support. Next draw Tuesday 11th June. Jackpot €1,600.
Condolences - Avondale GAA sends its sincerest condolences to the family of May Murphy from Aughrim who passed away peacefully yesterday. May was the mother of our former club hurler Ger Murphy and grandmother to current duel player Shane Browne and hurler Geroid Murphy. We extend our sympathy to May’s sons Pat, Ger and Kevin and to her daughter Martina and all their families. Rest in Heavenly Peace May. Ar dheis De go raibh an ainm dilis.
Wedding bells - Avondale GAA sends its heartiest congratulations to former player Adam Benson Byrne and his new wife Kirsty on their recent wedding. May you both have a lifetime of love and happiness.
Avondale Camogie
Congratulations to Thea Cullen from Avondale camogie club and her Wicklow camogie team who travelled to Pairc Esler last weekend to Play Down in the camogie and Wicklow won on a scoreline of Wicklow 2-12(18) to Downs 1-06(9)
Camogie Summer Camp 2024 - Are your kids too old to take part in our Mini All Ireland? Well we have not forgotten about them, why not sign up to our teenage summer camp, open to all teenage girls in the area Avondale Camogie Club will be hosting a camp that will be run over the course of three days.
While there will be some camogie sessions the camp will not be Camogie based as there will be an activity to suit everyone So if you’re looking for a way to socialise, new to the area, meet new people, and try new things.
Men’s Shed
Rathdrum Men’s Shed meet for social gatherings at the Parochial House on Tuesdays and Thursdays between 10am and 1pm and on Saturdays between 10am and 12 noon.
We are looking for new members, so if you are interested in joining us, please come along for a cup of tea and a friendly chat. For information, please call Tony on 087 1215413 or Johnny on 083 0637727.
We are organising a series of fundraising events to help us purchase premises for a workshop as well as social gatherings. Your support would be much appreciated. The planned events include a Pub Quiz in June, A Bag pack in July and a Split Pot Draw in August. Please look out for dates, times and venues for these events which we will publish nearer the dates.
Rathdrum Men’s Shed have organised a fundraiser split the pot - one prize draw will take place on 30th August at the Coffin Shed Cafe. Tickets cost €5 and are available from any of the men’s shed members or committee.
Rathdrum Parish News
Mass times - 16th June Clara vale at 9am; 23rd June Greenane at 10am; 30th June Clara Vale at 9am (SUBJECT TO CHANGE)
Cemetery Masses - Barndarrig: Tuesday 2nd July at 7.30pm. Three Mile Waters: Monday 8th July at 7.30pm. Castletimon: Monday 15th July at 7.30pm. Rathnew: Wednesday 17th July at 7.30pm. Glenealy: Saturday 20th July at 3pm. Killoughter: Tuesday 23rd July at 7.30pm. Rathdrum: Sunday 16th June at 3pm. Greenane Sunday 23rd July at 3pm.
Pilgrimage To Medjugorje - Maura and Michael Heffernan from Greenane are organising a pilgrimage to Medjugorje from 10th to 17th October. The price of the Pilgrimage is €785. If you would like more information contact Maura or Michael or contact Marian Pilgrimages on 01 8788159 or www.marian.ie
Masses, Prayer Groups and social Gatherings: Monday and Wednesday and Thursday and Friday- Mass at 9am in Rathdrum parish church except on public holidays when mass is at 11am instead
Tuesday-Eucharistic service at 9am in Rathdrum Parish Church
Sunday 11.30am in Rathdrum parish church 9.00am in Clara Vale - alternated week; 10.00am in Greenane church-alternated weeks Check website/facebook whether Greenane or Clara Vale
Confessions: Before vigil mass on Saturday evening or ask Fr Derek
Rosary: After 9am mass on Monday and Thursday and after Eucharistic service on Tuesday and before 9am mass on Wednesday and Friday in Rathdrum parish church. Rosary in Rathdrum Famine and workhouse graveyard 10am on the first Saturday of each month
Parish Office Opening Hours: Monday to Friday -9.30am to 12.30pm Tel: 040446517 Email:rpo2014frd@gmail.com
Fr Derek Doyle -040446517 Website: www.rathdrumparish.ie Live streaming: www,churchmedia.tv/Rathdrum or www.rathdrumparish.ie/webcam
Charity Fundraiser
A charity fundraiser for Irish Guide Dogs will take place in the Arklow Bay Hotel on Saturday 29th June from 7.30pm. Music by back to back Tickets available from Avondale Vets in Rathdrum or Arklow or Tinahely. Cost €30 per person. Phone 0402 33744 for more information
MAD drama school summer camp
Want to be a part of this exciting studio in Rathdrum? MAD drama school are running a summer camp from 22nd July to 26th July in Avondale GAA complex in Rathdrum. For age: 4-6 from 10am till 1pm and age 7+ from 1pm till 5pm
Contact 086 3981103 or email mad.drama.school@gmail.com for more information and to book a space.
Rathdrum Rugby Club
We are delighted to announce that the Rathdrum RFC Summer Sports Camp is returning for 2024! Booking will be open via our club shop ( www.rathdrumrfc.ie/products) from 10th June and is open to all, members and non members alike!
While the camp will have a rugby focus there will be lots of other sports and activities on offer so there’s something for everyone! Contact Kiera Burch at 086 8839843 for more information
The Rathdrum Rugby club annual general meeting (A.G.M) will take place on Friday 7th June starting at 8pm. The A.G.M will be held in the club house and all members are welcome.
Your News
Any group or organisation who wants to put notes in to the Rathdrum notes in the Wicklow People newspaper should forward the information via email to Sandyshaugh44@gmail.com or text/Whatsapp the message to 083 3575421 before 3pm on Sunday evening.
